sub_title: Innovation manager / VU Amsterdam Library / Merging ideas / Open Science, Research Intelligence, Scholarly Communication
summary:
Maurice Vanderfeesten, MSc, is a passionate merger of ideas by bringing connections to new scientific concepts and existing technologies. He is active in the area of innovations in the Scholarly Communication, Open Science and research data.

Core qualities: overviewing the bigger picture, passionate about the details. Analytical, creative, and accurate. Aligning the business and the ICT. Driving enthusiasm, bringing people together, learn from each other, and making people work with a smile.

Knowledge about: Project management and Process management.

Background knowledge about: Knowledge- and information architecture, persistent digital object infrastructures, repository infrastructures, semantic web concepts.

treasury_media.title: Innovation workshop: Advanced Services for Researchers
treasury_media.description: Revolutionising the way scholarly output is communicated, measured and valued. At this workshop a blend of technology professors, artists, startups, librarians and commercial parties had a platform to demonstrate and remix the state-of-the-art and out-of-the-box uses of new and existing information technology.

treasury_media.title: Get involved
treasury_media.description: engage and organise global communities to steer National directions. This photo was taken in Den Haag, where the Manifesto was written for international interoperability between persistent identifier services.

treasury_media.title: Be admired...
treasury_media.description: ... for the consistency of the color of your shirt on all occasions

treasury_media.title: Commitment creates smiles
treasury_media.description: Photo taken from the SURF Research and innovation Event 2012. Richard Zijdeman was happy about the committed guidance het got in the myResearch demo Portal demo.

treasury_media.title: Let people create their own innovation
treasury_media.description: Knowledge Infrastructure is not scary. Define the information ingredients you need, and let people build their own idea's they love to show others.

treasury_media.title: Engage in conversation
treasury_media.description: In the ORIS project, I have let people set their own goals, planning, quality assurance methods and ways of communication. Making them responsible for their own engagement in the project.

treasury_media.title: Build a sense of community
treasury_media.description: In the ORIS project, where 32 people have to work together from 20 different universities and universities of applied science, it is important that there is some sense of community. Building this community, making them feel more connected. Photography helps to build this sense of community.

treasury_media.title: Innovation by cooking on paper
treasury_media.description: My workshops are not only sit and listen, but what can you do with the information you just have learned. Photo from the Advanced Services for Researchers meeting - cooking with the "ingredients"

treasury_media.title: Organise inspiration
treasury_media.description:
I have organised this Advanced Services for Researchers meeting. The goal was to give the audience an inspirational boost for innovative idea's on developing new services for the use by researchers. 
Artists, scientists, and business people where put in one room, and got is all. They could listen to the state of art from technology professors, know what was already available, connect with other, building alliances, get to know great ideas and share it back home.

organizations.name: Knowledge Exchange
organizations.position: member of the Interoperability of Digital Repository working group

projects.title: Aurora SDG Research Dashboard
projects.description:
Aurora is a partnership of like-minded and closely collaborating research intensive European universities, who use their academic excellence to drive societal change and contribute to the sustainable development goals (SDGs). The SDG Research Dashboard enables you to see the research publications that relate to the Global Goals, how open and freely available these are to society, and what (non-)governmental organisations make use of these publications in their policy. 

Delivered: 
1. SDG Research Dashboard. along with the user guides on how to use the dashboard. Also we made some introduction and explainer video’s, and a manual how to build an SDG dashboard yourself.
2. SDG classifier and SDG badges, where you can dynamically generate an SDG wheel based on a text fragment in 104 languages, and code to embed on an web page.

projects.title: Scouting sessie - Research Information Landscape
projects.description:
The Linked data paradigm is a rising trend. How do the Research Information stakeholders react to this trend. Who are the partners to talk to in theNetherlands, are there feasible use cases? 
A lot of people are working in this field, but do they know eachother, or are thee opportunities for new exciting alliances?

My role is to organise and facilitate this meeting. Bringing people together for a meet and greet. Sharing ideas and knowledge.

projects.title: OpenAIRE
projects.description:
project: OpenAIRE aims to support the implementation of Open Access in Europe. It provides the means to promote  and realize the widespread adoption of the Open Access Policy, as set out by the ERC Scientific Council Guidelines for Open Access and the Open Access pilot launched by the European Commission.

my role: provide the project with expert advice on Metadata adaptations. Also provide expert input for Distributed Usage Statistics Harvesting Interoperablity

projects.title: ORIS project - Overdracht Research Informatie Standaarden
projects.description:
The aim of this project is to transfer all the agreements made for setting-up the repository knowledge infrastructure to the EduStandard organisation for maintaining the agreements.

My role is to act as project manager; creating a project plan with the people from some universities in the Netherlands, then getting the mandate and creating a bigger project team to actively participate.

projects.title: Study for a Research App Store
projects.description:
The aim of the project is a study for a Research App Store. What services do Dutch institutions offer to their researchers, What criteria there are for these services to transfer into Apps (embeddable application in VRE's), what the functional requirements are for an online 'shop' where researchers can find their desired apps. The project wil give input to SURFmarket's cloud distribution channel.

my role is project coordinator, creating a project plan with members of the Dutch institutions.

contributors.headline: Innovation manager / VU Amsterdam Library / Merging ideas / Open Science, Research Intelligence, Scholarly Communication
former research -data- support manager at Maastricht University Library

projects.title: PEER - Publishing and the Ecology of European Research
projects.description:
project: The aim of PEER is to investigate the effects of large-scale, systematic depositing of authors’ final peer-reviewed manuscripts. This is done by developing an 'observatory' to monitor the effects of systematic archiving over time and by creating  a substantial body of evidence.  Participating publishers will collectively contribute approx. 240 journals to the project and supporting research studies will address behavioral, economic and usage implications of Open Access material.

my role: advise the project with expert information on reposititory interoperability. Advice topics: Harvesting statistical usage data. Pushing publications towards repositories using SWORD ATOM Publication Profile. Other responsibilities: Reviewing the outcome of the scientific reports and disseminating the project results.

contributors.headline: Innovation manager / VU Amsterdam Library / Merging ideas / Open Science, Research Intelligence, Scholarly Communication
Research Infrastructure Consultant

projects.title: My Research Portal
projects.description:
The aim of the project was to create a proof-of-concept portal, where researchers can log-in with their insitutional accounts, and use services in the form of Open Social gadgets that researchers would like to use in their research. Apps for uploading data and publications, creating enhanced publications, etc. 

My role was the intermediate between the end-users and the developers from several suppliers of the infrastructure and the services. My responsibility was to complete the portal as a demonstrator at the National Research day.

projects.title: SURFshare Enhanced Publication Infrastructure
projects.description:
Create a data layer that is fit for Enhanced Publications. Seek national and international collaboration for creating interoperable standards. The data layer must be open and suffice for additional services to emerge on top. National and International repositories and collaboratories must adopt the new standards to generate the data needed for an Enhanced Publication data layer to emerge.
http://wiki.surffoundation.nl/display/vp/Infrastructuur

contributors.headline: Innovation manager / VU Amsterdam Library / Merging ideas / Open Science, Research Intelligence, Scholarly Communication
Policy advisor Strategy & Relations at SURF

projects.title: PersID
projects.description:
PersID is a successful international collaborative effort to progress the development and usage of persistent identifiers for research publications. 
It is an example demonstrating that with a consistent but flexible project management approach and sufficient attention for process management complex objectives can be achieved in a cross-border, multi-culture environment.

projects.title: EJME - Enhanced Journals Made Easy
projects.description:
This project was deployed to create Enhanced Publications in the workflow of normal publishing procedures. Creating addons for the Open Journal System provide a platform for deployment on a global scale. Documentation was added to make it easy for system administrators to install the addons and journal editors to work with it.

my role in this project was to act as Project Owner. Activities include to make the start of this project happen. Checking for the project feasibility. Allocating budget and find support in the SURF Knowledge Innovation Infrastructure Board. Scaffolding the project plan. Also providing quality assurance during the project. Accepting the project result.

projects.title: Enhanced Publications in NARCIS
projects.description:
The aim of this project is to harvest and present as much Enhanced Publications that have been delivered in the past tender projects. This final step makes the Enhanced Publication infrastructure complete. At this aggregated level interlinks between separate components of enhanced publications can emerge.

my role in this project was to act as Project Owner. Activities include to make the start of this project happen. Checking for the project feasibility. Allocating budget and find support in the SURF Knowledge Innovation Infrastructure Board. Scaffolding the project plan. Also providing quality assurance during the project. Accepting the project result.

contributors.headline: Innovation manager / VU Amsterdam Library / Merging ideas / Open Science, Research Intelligence, Scholarly Communication

projects.title: PERSID NL
projects.description:
The project was about consolidating the agreements in the Knowledge Information Infrastructure about Persistent Identifiers for digital objects. The project had to deliver a technical resolution framework with long term preservation backup capabilities. Repositories and the National Library play an important part. The project must provide a blueprint for an Registration Agency that is responsible for contract and certificate management (SLA). This can be used in a followup project. This project resulted in a complete new vision of the structuring of the Knowledge Information Infrastructure.

my role in this project was to act as Project Owner. Activities include to make the start of this project happen. Checking for the project feasibility. Allocating budget and find support in the SURF Knowledge Innovation Infrastructure Board. Scaffolding the project plan. Also providing quality assurance during the project. Accepting the project result

projects.title: SURE2 - Statistics on the Usage of Repositories
projects.description:
Based on the experiences of the previous project, this followup project Statistics on the Usage of Repositories 2 aims at scaling up the number of participating repositories and providing different usage statistics dashboards for repository managers, and authors of publications. both with reusable/embeddable data visualisation components.

my role in this project was to act as Project Owner. Activities include to make the start of this project happen. Checking for the project feasibility. Allocating budget and find support in the SURF Knowledge Innovation Infrastructure Board. Scaffolding the project plan. Also providing quality assurance during the project. Accepting the project result.

Project Manager at Leiden University Library

projects.title: PERSID KE
projects.description:
The Project is themed around Persistent Identifiers. The aim of the project was to make an interoperable Persistent Identifier framework that linked existing international URN:NBN resolvers and creating policy interoperability for Persistent Identifiers. The Policy interoperability defined the meaning of the word Persistence for organisations who want to join any Persistent Identifier infrastructure (URN:NBN, DOI, etc)

my role in this project was to provide expert advice to the project leader and to other members. The advice was about on creating a large resolution network, system behavior, resolution syntax,  Also quality assurance of the project results was my task. In the absence of the project leader in the middle of the project, I temporarily took his place.

projects.title: InContext Visualiser
projects.description: The visualiser ... let's you navigate through RDF relations in a smooth and understandable way. The objects in an enhanced publication are presented nice and clean like one reads a news paper to discover interesting material, and click on it to read details. The visualiser is playfull, friendly interfaced, usable and creates information scent for more discovery of information.

projects.title: SURE1 - Statistics on the Usage of Repositories
projects.description:
The Statistics on the Usage of Repositories project aims at providing a proof of concept for transferring Usage log data from distributed repositories to a central database for further analysis.
At the same time reaching out to international partners for creating an international accepted standard, using the Knowledge Exchange Organisation as a platform.

my role: Expert adviser and coordinating the communication between international partners. Later on I was responsible for successful finishing the proof of concept period and dissemination of the project results for followup.
